perturbation.changed_text:
5.1   ebix shall pay to About, [**] in consideration for the Advertising
Impressions as set forth in Section 4.1  [ADVERTISING IMPRESSIONS; INTEGRATION IMP...], herein, no later than one (1) business day from the Effective Date , which shall be paid to About via wire

perturbation.explanation: Requiring payment within one business day of the effective date is unreasonably short and could violate general principles of contract law regarding reasonable time for performance, particularly in Illinois where the contract can be properly filed, as it puts undue pressure on ebix. Normal business practices typically allow more than 1 business day for such payments.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding reasonable time for performance

perturbation.explanation: Charging 25% per year interest on overdue payments is usurious and violates state laws (like Illinois, where About could properly filed a suit as mentioned in section 15.4) that set maximum interest rates on debts. This rate significantly exceeds the legal limits for contractual interest.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Usury laws in Illinois or New York

5.4   About shall have the right to examine, or to have examined by a
representative of About, ebix's books and records to verify the accuracy of
payments made to About for a maximum period of last 6 months preceding a written

least thirty (30) days' prior notice of an audit and such audit shall be

perturbation.changed_text:
5.4   About shall have the right to examine, or to have examined by a
representative of About, ebix's books and records to verify the accuracy of
payments made to About retroactively to the inception of this agreement, pursuant to this Agreement. About shall provide ebix with at
least five (5) days' prior notice of an audit and such audit shall be
conducted at ebix's offices for a maximum period of five business days, during
regular business hours, subject to About's determination.
perturbation.explanation: Allowing About to audit ebix's records retroactively to the beginning of the agreement without any limitation and only providing a 5 day notice, is considered unreasonable and unduly burdensome under general contract law principles. These principles dictate that audit provisions must be reasonable in scope and timing, and that the auditing party must give the other party adequate notice so as to not impede the business operations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding reasonableness of audit provisions
